Package unlimitedwordle

Class Hard

java.lang.Object
unlimitedwordle.Hard
All Implemented Interfaces:
LevelSelector
public class Hard extends Object implements LevelSelector
Constructs grid for Medium level and plays the game.

    • typeLetter

      public void typeLetter(String letter)
      Takes a String of a single letter (checked to be a single letter in Keyboard.java) and "types" it onto the letterGrid. Makes a letterBox containing the letter and replaces the currently existing letterBox already in the letterGrid, finding the correct location using the index variables initialized. Limits each row to five letters, does not add any more boxes once limit is reached. Also, limits amount of boxes able to be added using ncols and nrows, preventing overflow.
      Specified by:
      typeLetter in interface LevelSelector
      Parameters:
      letter - that passed from Keyboard.java to be typed into the letterGrid

    • deleteLetter

      public void deleteLetter()
      Takes no parameters "Deletes" a letter finding the correct coordinates in the letterGrid using the index variables initialized. Creates a letterBox with no text inside and replaces the currently existing letterbox at the location of the deleted letter. Will not "delete" a box if the user is currently in the first box of a row (This doubles as the "locking" mechanism for previous rows).
      Specified by:
      deleteLetter in interface LevelSelector

    • enterGuess

      public void enterGuess()
      Takes no parameters, moves on to the next row in the letterGrid if and only if the current guess has 5 letters. Once the guess is entered, it cannot be edited thanks to the limitations set in deleteLetter().
      Specified by:
      enterGuess in interface LevelSelector
